section.title: Planned Orders by Planner Code
section.para: To view Planned Orders by Planner Code, select the "Planned Orders by Planner Code" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: When a Planned Work Order is released, the Create Work Order screen will appear with Work Order details automatically filled in. Releasing a Planned Purchase Order results in a Purchase Request, which may in turn be released from the Purchase Request reports.

section.para: When displaying Planned Orders by Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Planned Orders for all Planner Codes.
Specify Planner Code whose Planned Orders you want to display.
Enter a Planner Code pattern to select a range of Planner Codes. Refine your search using Regular Expressions.
Select to display Planned Orders by Planner Code for all Sites.
Specify Site whose Planned Orders by Planner Code you want to display.

note.para: In the case of Planned Purchase Orders, the quantity will always be represented in the Inventory Unit of Measure (UOM)â€”regardless of the Vendor UOM used on any existing Purchase Orders.

listitem.para: Display will show Planned Orders by Planner Code, using the specified parameters. Firm Planned Orders will display in blue.

tip.para: Planned Orders must be firm before they will be considered as a valid source of supply by Material Requirements Planning (MRP) when MRP is run.
